p.s: In the given excerpt from William Shakespeare's The Merchant of Venice Shylock and Tubal meet each other on a street in Venice.
In the following Shylock will be characterised.
Shylock is a Jewish man who lives in Venice (l. 0).
He has a daughter who ran away with a Christian man (l. 1).
Shylock's wife called Leah is dead which means he is now on his own (l. 24).
His daughter ran away and his wife died.
Because of these two aspects one can say that Shylock is a melancholic character.
By saying nor, no in luuh skipping but what lights on my shoulders (l. 8) Shylock presents himself as a very unlucky and unhappy person.
Shylock cares a lot about money.
He is very rich but he wants to keep his money.
These two aspects are shown his reaction to Tubal telling him that he cannot find his daughter (ll. 3-6).
Before his daughter left him he really liked her because he bought her earring with jewels which are worth two thousand ducats (l. 3-7).
But now because she ran away Shylock hates her.
He wishes she was dead lying in a coffin in front of him (l. 6).
This line shows that Shylock is a cruel person.
He wants his daughter to die because she stole a lot of money and it costs him a lot to try and find her (l. 8).
This view Shylock presents shows again that Shylock loves money and really cares about it.
Because of Shylock's religion he was not in a good position in the society lock in this time.
Although he was a rich person many people used to have antisemeticanti-semetic opinions so many people looked down on him for being a Jew.
One of these people who look down on him is Antonio.
Antonio is a Christian man who lives in Venice who also has a lot of money.
The difference between Shylock and Antonio is their religion and the outward appearance.
Shylock does not care aobut other people's opinion and he is very direct.
Antonio on the other hand really cares about what people think about him.
They both hate each other.
As soon as Tubal says Antonio's name Shylock reacts really surprised.
By repeating the word what (l. 12) three times this points gets proven.
As soon as Shylock receives the information that Antonio may break their bond he is really happy.
By repeating the sentence I am glad of it twice his happineshappiness is shown.
At the same time he is really cruel aswellas well.
I'll plague him; I'll torture him(l. 27) shows how brutal he is.
Shylock's use of language changes a lot.
He asks a lot of rhetorical questions (ll. 7, 12).
He also repeats himself very often I thank god (l. 14), good news (l. 16) and that's true (l. 26).
The level of his languages changes a lot too.
During his monologue he uses more high society words but if he asks questions or repeats himself he uses basic words.
This proves the point that he could be part of the high society but he is not because of his religion.
All in all one can say that Shylock is a very lively character who can also be very brutal and direct.
